Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 19, mean = 44, sd = 3.43 Sample 2: n = 10, mean = 29, sd = 6.52. The pooled variance estimator takes the value of 22.01. It is tested Whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* A T distribution with 27 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 19 and 10 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 18 and 9 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 29 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* A T-distribution with 27 degrees of freedom: Correct
* An F-division with 19 and 10 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 18 and 9 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 29 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
